boardgame.name: NOVA: Race from the Sun 5th Player Expansion
boardgame.description:
The 5th Player Expansion for NOVA: Race from the Sun includes everything necessary for a 5th player including 12 additional Tech Cards, 15 dice in 8 colors, a player mat, and a spaceship player marker.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Warfare on Distant Planets
boardgame.description:
Warfare on Distant Planets is a set of rules for science fiction battles with 6mm figures.

Humanity has spread to the stars and they are not alone now they battle with various other races to control distant as of yet unnamed planets.

The rules have a random army choice system that ensures that games are not always evenly matched sometimes winning just means doing as much damage as possible before your troops are defeated.

Stats are given for a number of different forces and it would be easy to create your own as well.

boardgame.name: Card Bard
boardgame.description:
Card Bard is a 2 – 4 player card game in which each player takes the role of the magical traveling storyteller of old — The Bard.

A player’s deck represents their repertoire of ballads, stories, techniques, tricks, magical items, fantastical lore, and enchanting melodies that you will use to battle your opponent to win the hearts – and purses – of the folk of the land.

During the game, players use their cards to perform Songs and collect Fame. The game ends when a player accumulates 15 Fame and has no currently active Songs. That player wins the game.

Card Bard plays over a series of alternating turns that are made up of 4 steps. Each of these steps takes place every turn, even if nothing happens during the step.

1. Play: Use your available Actions to play or draw cards, and activate effects.

2. Resolve: Resolve all effects still in play then check for the win condition.

3. Recover: Recharge Actions, discard any unwanted and cards over the hand limit.

4. Draw: Draw back up to the hand limit.

While Card Bard can be played with the pre-constructed decks, much of the depth comes when players construct original decks. Each deck must contain exactly 31 cards, including their Bard and no more than three copies of any card, by name. Within these guidelines, any combination of song and composition cards can be used. The Bard card is a special card that your deck revolves around. Bards determine what types of cards you can play. All cards in your deck must either match your Bard’s instrumental mastery type or be of a neutral type. Bards also have special effects that can be used by paying the costs associated with them, listed on the card.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Promo Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Promotional pack for organised play
Contents are detailed below. The number before each card is the number of copies of that card in the bundle.

10 Benedito, a Lanterna
10 Bituin
10 Casey Snyder
10 Jacques Rouge
10 Leumeah
1 Una
1 The Ankara Citadel, Turkey
1 Black Metamorphosis
1 Murmur of the False Will
1 Parity Shift
1 Pentex Subversion

boardgame.name: Player's Play
プレイヤーズプレイ
boardgame.description:
Player's Play is a card game in which players can choose to participate ("play") each round or not, and the number of players that participate will determine what type of game is played.

Each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards, and 4 participation cubes. Two cards form the deck are turned face up and will determine the trump suits for the game. In turn order, the players decide if they wish to participate, spending a participation cube if they choose to do so.

If one player participates, it will be a solitaire game. If two players participate, it is a blackjack style game. If three players participate, it is a poker style game. If four participate, it is a trick-taking game. If a player wins one of these mini-games, they receive a victory point, and the first person to three victory points wins.

boardgame.name: White Star Wizard
boardgame.description:
Pad Pad games are board games on small pads (1/3 A4). The board and the rules are on every sheet and everyone gets a sheet. The pad and a pencil is all that is needed. No big board to lay out, no fiddly pieces, easy to carry and simple rules, so the games can be played almost anywhere; on a ferry, train, waiting room, tent etc.

Story; You are a powerful Elemental Wizard. To prove you are the best, you have challenged your friends to a friendly competition. Try to outsmart the other wizards and become a White Star Wizard.

Each player is a wizard casting Elemental spells, trying to score the most victories before all Elements have been conquered.

boardgame.name: Student Union
boardgame.description: Set in modern times, this story contains suspense, romance, and mystery. Your choices guide Lane Fox through major branching paths as shifting pressures form, strain, and shatter strong bonds. You'll found a student government, recruit members, and struggle to maintain them in the face of unexpected challenges and danger.

boardgame.name: Refighting History: Volume 8 – The Seven Years War Western Theatre: Small Actions
boardgame.description:
Looking at the Seven Years War, military historians tend to concentrate on the big battles. However, the day to day campaign activity of the combatants included reconnaissance, raids, probing actions, resupply and a host of other minor operations that frequently lead to small skirmishes.

What I want to do in this volume of Refighting History is to take some of these actions, however small, and however sketchy in terms of accounts, and turn them into wargames. They will also demonstrate that you do not need large armies to wargame the Seven Years War.
The Western Theatre accounts provide details of the day to day activity by both armies. Coupled with this, the great variety of light and irregular troops provides a whole range of different unit.

The result is this volume with nine small historical actions refought on the wargame table. There is also a significant amount of background on the units involved coupled with art work to illustrate the uniforms.

—description from designer

The scenarios are compatible with many rulesets although Sharp Practice ! is recommended by the author (who uses his own modifications of his set The War Game Rules).
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sharp Practice: Wargame Rules for Large Skirmishes in the Era of Black Powder, 1700 to 1865

boardgame.name: Refighting History: Volume 1 – Seven Years War: Fighting Withdrawals
boardgame.description:
Refighting History is a series of wargame books by Charles S Grant. In this series Charles describes historical actions, provides the detail of the forces involved and the preparation to bring the actions to the wargame table. Each refight is then described both in words and pictures. These will include not only famous larger battles but also smaller actions which can be achieved with modest wargame forces.

In addition to the battles (Asch, Hoyerswarda, Pretsch) and games Charles includes sections on tactics, troop types and the development of his own armies.

The series aim to bring research, real scenarios , lots of pictures and the fun of wargaming to the reader.

—description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sharp Practice: Wargame Rules for Large Skirmishes in the Era of Black Powder, 1700 to 1865

boardgame.name: Refighting History: Volume 2 – The War of the Austrian Succession: Mollwitz, Chotusitz and Sahay
boardgame.description:
Having covered some relatively small actions in Volume 1 of Refighting History Volume 2 examines some larger battles. The battles in question come from the War of the Austrian Succession and more specifically the First Silesian War.

The first battle is something of a wargame classic - Mollwitz. The Grant’s first Mollwitz wargame is coved with an excerpt from The War Game describing how it was first fought back in 1968. The battle is then revisited and with quite different results. There is then “A slice of Mollwitz” looking at only one particular part of the same battle.

The second battle, Chotusitz, is rather less well known and took place the year after Mollwitz. The battle includes an unusual twist but you will have to read it to discover what it is.

The third battle is the rather obscure battle of Sahay. This battle required quite a lot of detective work and no small amount of conjecture. The end result is a most interesting action.

In addition to the battles there is an update on Charles’ wargame armies and a section on battlefield manoeuvre in the mid eighteenth and its implications for wargaming.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: War of the Austrian Succession

boardgame.name: Ruas Perigosas: Expansion for Zurvivors
boardgame.description: Dangerous Streets: Expansion for Zurvivors is a Card Game that will offer new experiences with the Zurvivors base game, with new survivors, expanding the city with establishments, challenges and obstacles, making the game even more exciting!

boardgame.name: For Motherland! The Russian Front, 1941-44
boardgame.description:
For Motherland! The Russian Front, 1941-44 is the single map game design by renowned Japanese game designer, Masahiro Yamazaki. This edition features a mounted map and delivers an eminently-playable version of his original, two-map War for the Motherland release that can be played to completion in a single sitting.

The game begins with Operation Barbarossa marking the German invasion of the Soviet Union, and culminates towards the end of the war when the Russians had effectively driven back the German forces and were entering the final stages of the epic struggle on the Eastern Front when the tide had completely turned. The game includes four variable turn scenarios:

Operation Barbarossa (1 to 7 Game-Turns),
The Road to Stalingrad (1 to 12 Game-Turns),
Fall Blau (8 to 17 Game-Turns), and
War for the Motherland campaign (1 to 22 Game-Turns).


One of the nice new twists implemented for the strength chit system is the variable and increasing combat chit strength for the Soviets over time to model the increasing combat effectiveness of the Soviet Armies.

Product Information:
Complexity: 5 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 7 out of 10 (no hidden units)
Time Scale: 1 or 2 months per turn
Map Scale: 74 km per hex
Unit Scale: Army (Soviets, Axis Minors) and Corps (German)
Players: one to two, best with two
Playing Time: 2-5 hours for scenarios, 8+ hours for campaign

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm – Der Untergang von Cadia
Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm – Fall of Cadia
Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm – La Caduta di Cadia
Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm – La Caída de Cadia
Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm – La Chute de Cadia
boardgame.description:
Gathering Storm: Fall of Cadia is a campaign supplement for the Seventh Edition of Warhammer 40,000. It is a 1st part of the Gathering Storm series.

For ten thousand years Cadia has stood firm against the horrors spewed forth by the Eye of Terror. There are no records of how many valiant souls have fallen defending the fortress worlds of the Cadian Gate — but by their sacrifice, the tide of horror stemmed. But there is no sacrifice big enough to stop what is coming.

Abaddon has unleashed the full might of his thirteenth Black Crusade and little hope remains. On Cadia itself, Ursarkar Creed and manifold Imperial forces mount a desperate defence, and they are soon to be joined by the strangest and most powerful of allies. Their arrival spurs a chain of events that will change things forever – the pylons will fall, the Eye will open, and a storm will come.

Full rules for fielding Saint Celestine, Belisarius Cawl and Inquisitor Greyfax with any army of the Imperium:

Saint Celestine confers Act of Faith on nearby units
Belisarius Cawl confers the Canticles of the Omnissiah on nearby units

Inquisitor Greyfax brings 6 new Inquisition Tactical Objectives

The Triumvirate of the Imperium – a formation bringing these three characters together;

6 new Ecclesiarchy Relics and 6 Arcana Mechanicum, usable by Adepta Sororitas and Cult Mechanicus forces;

The Grand Convocation and Imperial Crusade detachments – combine Cult Mechanicus,Skitarii and Mechanicus Knights in one army, and Black Templars and Adepta Sororitas in another;

Battlezone: Empyric Storms – rules for raging Warp Storm effects, some of which can be quite drastic: potentially removing invulnerable saves, or halving the effective range of psychic powers...

4 new Echoes of War missions.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Capitulum Adprobavit – 2003 Edition
Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Chapter Approved – 2003 Edition
boardgame.description:
A series of three expansion books for Warhammer 40,000 third edition. Like the Book of the Astronomican for Rogue Trader, this short-lived annual collected articles from White Dwarf featuring various new rules, updates to the game, and army lists - some official, others merely experimental. There is substantial overlap between the volumes as each subsequent one was in part meant to update and/or collect much of the material of the previous.

The original in the series, Chapter Approved, was published in 2001, with Chapter Approved 2003 following in 2002 and Chapter Approved 2004 in 2003 (the year in the title indicating the coming year rather than when it was published). They were also known as the Second, Third, and Fourth Book of the Astronomican, respectively, in homage to the original from Rogue Trader.



Army Lists
- Feral Orks for use with the Codex: Orks
- Gaunt's Ghosts for use with the Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 1st Codex)
- Armageddon Imperial Guard Regiments for use with the Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 1st Codex)
- City Fight Imperial Guard for use with the Codex: Imperial Guard (3rd Edition, 1st Codex)
- Kroot Mercenaries
- Tyranid Seeding SwarmsAdditional Rules
- Trial Assault Rules
- Minor Psyker Powers
- Deathwatch Space Marines
- Transport Vehicles
- The Emperor's Champion

Scenarios
- Cityfight Subplots

Codex Updates
- Reprint updates for Space Marines, Armageddon, Orks, Blood Angels, Catachans, Eldar & Craftworld Eldar
- Revisions for Dark Eldar and Dark Angels

Playing and Painting
- Tactica: Cityfight
- 'Eavy Metal Showcase
- Tau Colour Schemes
- Painting Chaos Space Marines

boardgame.description:
A series of three expansion books for Warhammer 40,000 third edition. Like the Book of the Astronomican for Rogue Trader, this short-lived annual collected articles from White Dwarf featuring various new rules, updates to the game, and army lists - some official, others merely experimental. There is substantial overlap between the volumes as each subsequent one was in part meant to update and/or collect much of the material of the previous.

The original in the series, Chapter Approved, was published in 2001, with Chapter Approved 2003 following in 2002 and Chapter Approved 2004 in 2003 (the year in the title indicating the coming year rather than when it was published). They were also known as the Second, Third, and Fourth Book of the Astronomican, respectively, in homage to the original from Rogue Trader.

boardgame.name: Seikkailuja ja Sankareita
boardgame.description:
Translated from back of the book:
Finland has exceptionally vivid roleplaying culture. Tabletop roleplaying agmes have been produced here for over 30 years and they have been played even longer. Our country has a culture of game design and domestic publishing, which produces unique and distinctive games in a steady pace. Even though English language games are in a significant position in here as well, Finnish roleplaying is alive and kicking.

Seikkailuja ja Sankareita (Eng. Adventures and Heroes) exhibits Finnish roleplaying history and present. The nine articles in the book go through domestic publishing, gaming culture, organizations, events, retail and research professionally and supported by figures.

"This book is a "must have" for everyone interested in Finnish roleplaying and to others it still provides an excellent source of information and unique reading experience." -Risto "Nordic" Hieta, game designer

Back of the book in Finnish:
Suomessa on poikkeuksellisen vireä roolipelikulttuuri. Täällä on tehty pöytäroolipelejä yli 30 vuoden ajan ja niitä on pelattu sitäkin kauemmin. Maassamme on pelisuunnittelun ja kotimaisen julkisun kulttuuri, joka tuottaa omaleimaisia ja itsensä näköisiä pelejä tasaisella tahdilla. Vaikka englanninkieliset pelit ovat täälläkin merkittävässä asemassa, suomalainen roolipeli elää ja voi hyvin.

Seikkailuja ja Sankareita esittelee suomalaisen roolipelaamisen historiaa ja nykypäivää. Kirjan yhdeksän artikkelia käyvät läpi kotimaista julkaisutoimintaa, pelikulttuusia, järjestötoimintaa, tapahtumia, vähittäiskauppaa ja tutkimusta asiantuntevasti ja kuvien tukemana.

"Tämä teos on pakkohankinta jokaiselle kotimaisesta roolipelaamisesta kiinnostuneelle ja muillekin taatusti erinomainen tiedonlähde ja ainutkertainen lukuelämys." -Risto "Nordic" Hieta, pelisuunnittelija
boardgame.rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)

boardgame.name: Chevaliers: Livre 4 – Princesse Gargea
Knights Club: The Alliance of Dragons
boardgame.description:
Previously, you met King Orc, whose daughter is missing. On the advice of his most loyal friend, the Prince of Nekashu, the King has entrusted you with a mission of the utmost importance: to bring his child back safe and sound by pulling her out of the clutches of the terrible mountain scoundrels....

Chevaliers 4 is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fluxx: Twist Gaming Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
is a New promo pack for Fluxx. It was offered as a reward to certain tiers in the "Twist Gaming Kickstarter - Year 4" campaign.
The pack contains 8 new cards to add to the game.

boardgame.name: Respect
boardgame.description:
Here you will find the worst criminals, thieves and scammers in the country. You must make a hole in the prison, earning the respect of the rest. It will not be easy, but not impossible!

Take advantage of the special abilities you have, complete missions, learn to defend yourself, win battles against other prisoners, buy your protection, get involved in the mafia, manage your money well and get to be the master of "LA PERLA" no matter what.

Players will become prisoners, seeking the utmost respect, taking on the role of Mario El Fuerte, Moe El Soplón, Harry El Loco, Jack El Carterista, Mr. White El Estafador and Qiang El Yakuza.

The player who gets 15 respect points wins.

boardgame.name: 3 out of 10, EP 1: "Welcome To Shovelworks"
boardgame.description:
User Summary

First episode of a narrative mini-game compilation set in a video game development studio.

boardgame.name: Battle for Kursk: The Tigers Are Burning, 1943
boardgame.description:
"Battle for Kursk: The Tigers Are Burning, 1943", allows players to explore the major what-ifs of the Eastern Front during that pivotal year. Could von Manstein launch Operation Citadel early, or not at all? What if another objective was chosen for the Summer offensive? Similarly, could the Russian counteroffensive have been directed elsewhere, or be stopped on the banks of the Dnieper? Each turn the players must secretly select a posture, which impacts the types of activities they can perform that turn and the number of replacements they will receive.

Game Design by Trevor Bender. Volume I in the C3i Combined Arms Series. INSIDE C3i Magazine Nr34 published by RBM Studio.

Winner of the 2020 Charles S. Roberts award for
—Best Magazine Board Wargame
—Best Expansion
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Magazine Board Wargame Nominee
2020 Charles S. Roberts Magazine Board Wargame Winner

boardgame.name: Vision Soft Reset
boardgame.description:
User Summary

2D action-adventure exploration platform game (Metroidvania) with a time-travel twist. Time can be rewound a short amount to correct mistakes in combat or tricky platforming, and exploration is aided by branching timelines created at save points.

boardgame.name: Gods Love Dinosaurs
Ein Paradies für Dinosaurier
boardgame.description:
How do you make an ecosystem flourish with just enough of every life form in the chain to supply you with dinosaurs to dominate the lands? Resources are scarce, animals can go extinct in an area, and everyone must eat to survive — so moves must be cunning. Life hangs in the balance...

In Gods Love Dinosaurs, a cheeky, wild, and timeless take on the scientific tale as old as life itself, you are a god who has been tasked with designing an ecosystem with a sustainable food chain of predator and prey animals. But you just love dinosaurs, so all you really want to do is to make as many of them as possible!

Each turn, you'll add one tile to your ecosystem, which will add new animals and give them room to grow. Every so often, your dinosaurs will tromp around your ecosystem eating all the animals. The more they eat, the more eggs they lay — and the more points you score! Just be careful not to overeat, or there won't be enough food to keep your dinosaurs alive the next time.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Fistful of Daisies
Pour une poignée de marguerites
boardgame.description:
In the valley of Herens in A Fistful of Daisies, cows fight one another to win succulent flowers, then get back to the cowshed first.

Each cow player starts with a board showing flowers that they want to eat. On a turn, one player rolls the dice, then each player drafts a die in turn. Players then take turns moving their cows, and if they end their movement in a flower field matching a color they want to eat, then they take a token and cover one of those colored spaces on their board. If they land where another cow is located, they must duel! Roll the cows to see who ends up showing more spots; whoever wins collects clover tokens equal to the number of spots you rolled, and as soon as you have at least four clover, you had in four to cover a flower of your choice.

Whoever first covers all their flowers, then returns to the cowshed from which they started movement on this circular board wins.

boardgame.name: Stationfall
boardgame.description:
What is Stationfall? Well, imagine a dozen or so random humans, robots, and none-of-the-aboves, each with their own abilities, goals, and secret relationships, have been turned loose on a space station that is going to be incinerated upon its inevitable reentry into Earth's atmosphere. You are one of these characters, and the others are collaborators you have on hand ready to assist you in achieving your goals. But choose them wisely, as any one of them could secretly be another player waiting to betray you!


Stationfall is a box full of creative solutions, but that box is going to morph, twist, and grow teeth over the course of play. Your best turns will exploit the unique tactical freedom of being a secret conspiracy, as well as deductions about your opponents’ identities and motives. Stationfall is messy, intricate, and full of dangerous variables.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cafe Chaos
boardgame.description:
Join me (James) and my friends in the world’s most chaotic food fight. Dodge, hide and throw epic food combos to avoid being eliminated. Who will reign supreme in this chaotic food frenzy?

Each round of Cafe Chaos gets more chaotic as events are triggered in the school cafeteria. Watch out for school bullies, poisoned food and characters throwing epic food combos!

Cafe Chaos cards feature art from "The Odd 1s Out" world. You'll recognize a few favorites - but I've added some original characters to this game as well. The booster packs will add to the fun and include some of my animator friends.

So if you like food...and card games - this is the game for you. Help me make this card game a reality by backing Cafe Chaos today. And remember - wear your seatbelt!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tower Chess
boardgame.description:
Tower Chess is a chess variant that takes place on a 6x6 grid. The game does not include any knights, and 2 less pawns per side.

Aside from the size, the main twist in the game is that rather than pieces being removed from the board, the pieces are tiles and they are simply stacked. When a piece is moved, only the top most piece of a stack is moved. Pieces that were once covered will be able to move again if the pieces atop them are moved first. You may "capture" your own pieces by landing atop them.

As usual, the player to first capture the opponent's king, or in this case, place one of their pieces atop, will win.

boardgame.name: The Curious Stairs of Mr. Hincks
boardgame.description:
The Curious Stairs of Mr. Hincks is an escape room in a box prequel to The Curious Elevator of Mr. Hincks that is a standalone challenge.

Players will be solving puzzles on their way up to Mr. Hincks. You'll be using a website to check answers but hints are available if you get stuck.

boardgame.name: Aeon Must Die!
boardgame.description: Experience a unique beat-em-up introducing breakneck, risk-reward gameplay, innovative tactical fighting, and an RPG alignment system that tracks how you behave as a warrior.

boardgame.name: The Gaia Knight
boardgame.description:
"Break them against your body!

In this Ranger sub-class, invoke the ancient rites and become one with the forces of nature. Don your Gaia Armor and become the avatar of the natural world. No mountain shall be too steep, nor valley too wide for you to traverse and claim as your domain. By devoting yourself to becoming the bastion of all untouched lands, you will become a truly unstoppable force on the battlefield. Bolster the defenses of you and your allies, never let your movement be hindered, and become the unshakable pillar that the spirits of nature desire you to be!

Please enjoy the third supplement from IMP Games: The Gaia Knight!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: La Marche du Crabe
boardgame.description:
We are the last representatives of a particular species of decapod crustaceans: square crabs from the Gironde estuary. From an evolutionary point of view, we are not used much, especially because ... well we are physically unable to turn. Condemned to walk in a straight line all our life… and not even from the front, but… like a crab! Anyway, not a crazy life ... Bad luck for those born between two rocks.

But we are still not that stupid, because after only a few hundred thousand years, we very quickly realized that in two, climbing on top of each other alternately , and without any ambiguity, we could crisscross our entire environment, so that new horizons are offered to us!

Let's take advantage of this discovery to free our friends trapped under the filth left on the beach by humans a little too negligent, while avoiding our enemies of always: the terrible and idiot cakes, and also the terrifying and sly lobsters ...

Crab Walk is a super immersive cooperative deduction game, in which the two playful crabs will be completely dependent on each other ... not to mention! You have often seen crabs discuss, will you?

An evolving game!
To ensure an unlimited lifespan and a growing challenge, the game is scalable, with eleven Scenario cards and as many new challenges!
The promise of unlimited play and always new games!

HOW TO PLAY

On his turn, the player must play a Vilain card on the beach and then move the crabs token. If he stops on an Object Card, his friend tells him if it's a forbidden one or if it's ok.

HOW TO WIN

To win, the two players must free together their 8 friend's crabs before all the Villains are on the beach. Moreover, shrimps being life points, players lose if they must use shrimps and they don't have anymore!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Katz und Maus
boardgame.description:
Katz und Maus was published as a supplement to Auerbach's Deutschem Kinder-Kalender für 1913.

Up to 10 players play the mice and one player plays the cat. Te mice have to get from space 1 to space 64 without getting caught by the cat. If the cat and a mouse get on the same space, the mouse gets eaten and is out of play. If a player rolls more than he needs to reach space 64, he has to move the surplus points backwards.

Movement is determined by 2 dice (only 1 die from space 60 onward). Only the mice may use the diagonal lines, the cat has to go around. If the cat gets on an unnumbered intersection near the image of a cat, it needs to roll doublets to move again or has to pay 3 coins in it's third next turn. If a mouse gets near a hiding hole it may chose to stop there with it's last moving point, to be safe from the cat.

If the cat rolls a doublet, it may move backwards to catch a mouse. If a mouse rolls a doublet or reaches a space with the image of a mouse, it's roll counts double.

If the cat gets to space 64 before any mouse it wins the game and the whole stake. If a mouse reaches space 64 the cat may only move up to space 63 and wait there for the remaining mice.

The players pay a stake of 2 coins for each mouse and the same amount of coins for the cat. If the cat passes a mouse the mouse has to pay 1 coin to the cat and vice versa. If several mice use the same hiding hole, each has to pay 1 coin to the first mouse.

When there isn't any mouse remaining in play, the mice in space 64 and the cat share the stake.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: Chainsaw Warrior
boardgame.description:
Can you save New York in 60 minutes? The fate of the World depends on your success! Kit yourself out with some of the finest military and illegal weaponry the US Army's Special Ops Unit can supply. Then go kick some butt!

From: Archive of game site at http://web.archive.org/web/20010405145028/http://www.chainsawwarrior.com/chainsaw/home.htm

boardgame.name: The Highwayman
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Shinomen Mori—a gargantuan, sprawling forest, blanketing much of western Rokugan with its primeval spread. Beneath the shadow of its canopy, countless mysteries lie undisturbed, but the Shinomen can also be a place of great darkness, as the Shadowlands Taint festers and takes root. Within this forest, nothing is as it seems, but this is where your path leads in a new adventure.

Fantasy Flight Games is proud to present The Highwayman, a new adventure for Legend of the Five Rings Roleplaying that’s free to download from our website today!

The Highwayman debuted at Gen Con 2019 as a one-shot adventure that we hosted in some of our roleplaying game sessions, and now, we’re happy to make it widely available to every Game Master who’s interested in running the adventure themselves.

Unlike the grand majority of your adventures in Legend of the Five Rings Roleplaying, The Highwayman is not an adventure designed for a party of samurai in the service of their Great Clans. Instead, you’re invited to play as gaijin foreigners, rōnin, and peasant characters, experiencing a radically different side of life in Rokugan and drawing on many of the new rules and options introduced in the Path of Waves sourcebook.

At the beginning of your adventure, you’ve spent several months working small jobs for Ito Moronoka, a simple merchant. His latest job for you will certainly pay well at six koku apiece—and that’s for simply tracking down an absent courier and some missing sake. You set out for the small town of Kawacho, but when the trail leads into Shinomen Mori, you can be certain that things will not end as simply as they began…
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings Roleplaying Game (5th Edition)

boardgame.name: GYÜMI GÉNIUSZ: Smoothie promo
boardgame.description:
Shuffle the Smoothie promo cards into the base Gyumi Genius deck then prepare it as it’s written in the game rules.

When a player draws a Smoothie card in their own round it’s not obligatory to keep it! From now on you can collect different fruits and numbers for more points.

If the cards and numbers are duplicated you will get - 11 points.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Recipe Roundup
boardgame.description:
Recipe Roundup is a card game whose purpose is to learn about the ingredients that make up delicious, healthy meals. Chefs collect the necessary ingredients to complete the perfect recipes. Ingredients are limited so the competition can be dicey. Chefs can strategically stock ingredients in their pantry, while others are left for their friends to “borrow”. If another Chef poaches your key ingredient, you’ll have to scramble or you’ll be in hot water. Chefs can expand their palette with new recipes, but beware of holding too many ingredients or you’ll be left holding the bag (of wasted food).

Players score points for completed Recipes and lose points for anything unused. Each Ingredient and Recipe is assigned a point value (top right corner of the card) based on the rarity of the required Ingredients, as well as the demand for those Ingredients in the Recipes. Collected Ingredients that aren’t made into a Recipe are wasted in the players’ Kitchens. Points for wasted Ingredients are subtracted: wasting food is bad! The player with the most points at the end of the round (or several rounds) wins.

-description from publisher

listing.notes: Worldwide shipping available. Priority mail flat rate envelope typically ~$8 for up to 4 units.

boardgame.name: Blaseball
boardgame.description:
Blaseball is baseball at your mercy. Baseball perfected. Our players are inhuman. They play day and night. Rain or shine. They never grow sick. They never tire.

This is our gift to you — the fans. We hear your prayers at trade deadlines. We suffer your DH debates. No more. Democracy returns to the national pastime. Each week, you vote to remake the league in your own image. Everything from rules to rosters is in your hands.

Of course, votes aren’t free. Cash is king. So do what you do best. Gamble. Betting is allowed and encouraged. But parents fear not — your currencies and credit cards have no value here. Blaseball deals in its own dollar.

Seasons run Monday to Friday. The Postseason runs on Saturday. On Sunday, we rest.

Your first vote is on us. The fate of the league is on you.

Rejoice. Play ball.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Every Journey Begins on a Road: A Five Leagues From the Borderlands Expansion pack
boardgame.description:
This expansion pack for Five Leagues From the Borderlands is usable with any campaign and adds a new "roadside" encounter table.

This can be integrated into any campaign to add more variety, offering some low-intensity encounters against spiders, bandits and wandering fanatics.

This also means not every encounter you have is intrinsically tied to a Threat, making the game feel more alive and organic.

Additionally the pack also gives you a new tutorial sequence for starting a campaign, letting a new warband gain some experience and ease into the game before facing the full might of the Borderlands.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 2nd Edition

boardgame.name: Cohorts: Battles of Imperial Rome
boardgame.description:
Cohorts is a wargame system to land battles in Imperial Rome on 6mm to 20mm scale.
The basic fighting unit is a Century (Rome) and a Unit (Gauls, Germans, and Britons).
These are grouped into Cohorts and Bands.

Turns are performed by alternate activation.

Basic unit types are: infantry, cavalry, artillery (Scorpion), and special units (Nobles, Skirmishers, Chariots, Fanatics).

The objective is to provide an easy, agile, and adaptable rules system for the simulation of combat in the historical period between 200 BC and 200 AD, especially the period of Roman conquests over central Europe and Brittany. The main temporal focus is the Gallic Wars.

The definitions of a range of weapons were based on historical sources and serious publications. Likewise, the rules for combat formations and the historical characteristics of each army were also the target of research in specialized bibliography on the subject.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Global Crisis: A Cooperative Game of Future Earth
boardgame.description:
Overview
GLOBAL CRISIS blends cooperative game play with elements of hidden role games. Your leadership represents a major world superpower and a collective of nations. Can you overcome ancient challenges and bring about world peace? Global Crisis is a collaborative game (with a twist) where everyone is working to stabilize global chaos. The twist is that one player might be an agent of chaos. Yes, might. This potential saboteur raises suspicion and increases the challenge. Trust will have to be earned, hopefully before it is too late!

Game Play
If players collectively score enough points, they win. Players score by passing as many global policies as possible (before time runs out) to address the five overarching sets of Global Challenges. If a player is the "Agent of Chaos," that player can only win if the group scores in the lowest bracket possible—thus causing all other players to collectively lose.

This game can be played with 2 to 5 players. All players begin with five cards. In the initial rounds, players gather as much information as they can about the cards in the hands of other players. Next, they will aid each other to remove challenge cards from their hands, organize them by sets (color), and finally try to score on each set. There are five sets of challenges that can score. Scoring is based on how many cards within a set the group can collect and whether the group can form a unique policy on each set—all before time runs out. Time expires when the players have formed a policy for all five sets of challenges, or when a player attempts to draw a card from the deck, but the deck has run out.

Theme
Global Crisis::, Earth 2265, the world is on the edge of total annihilation. Natural, social, political, military, and corporate forces have pushed humanity to the brink. The words of a Persian mystic and prisoner who foresaw the future 400 years prior stands truer than ever before...

"O ye the elected representatives of the people in every land! Take ye counsel together, and let your concern be only for that which profiteth mankind, and bettereth the condition thereof . . . Regard the world as the human body which, though at its creation whole and perfect, hath been afflicted, through various causes, with grave disorders and maladies. Not for one day did it gain ease, nay its sickness waxed more severe, as it fell under the treatment of ignorant physicians . . ." —Bahá'u'lláh

In fits and starts the process of creating global stability has been emerging for eons. Now the world faces it's most dire hour. The super-science of catastrophic weaponry, imbalanced and exploited globalization, and the unlocked potentials of Mother Nature's wrath have all given rise to myriad horrific problems which require a host of powerful solutions.

Forces of light and dark battle openly in public discourse, secretly behind the closed doors of the powerful elite, and deep within the minds and hearts of all people. Despite those who cling to a world long gone, a consensus has formed among the world's peoples and great leaders: a new world must be made. Led by the charge of reason and fueled by a desperate hope, a rallying cry for peace is heard:

"The Great Peace towards which people of goodwill throughout the centuries have inclined their hearts, of which seers and poets for countless generations have expressed their vision, and for which from age to age the sacred scriptures of mankind have constantly held the promise, is now at long last within the reach of the nations." —From "The Promise of World Peace" by The Universal House of Justice

Is it too late to counteract eons of destruction? Can humanity set aside their petty squabbles, age old hatreds, and demagogue-stoked fears in order to bring about what is only dreamed of? And what of suspicions? Is everyone a trusted ally or do some lurk in shadow, attempting to plunge the world into a dark age of fallout and waste?

You are the rulers and leaders who will settle the fate of the world, for better or worse!

—description from the designer

listing.notes: Title: Global Crisis: A Cooperative Game of Future Earth Publisher: Studio 9 Incorporated Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Black Seas: Bomb Ketch Squadron
boardgame.description:
A bomb ketch’s primary armament was not cannon or carronade, but a mortar mounted near the bow elevated at a high angle, that employed explosive shells rather than solid shot. They were designed primarily as bombardment vessels (hence the name bomb ketch), and were deployed against fixed land positions.

Though the British first employed a bomb vessel in 1347, it was the French who would develop a design (in the late 17th century) closer to those seen in the Age of Sail. The British copied and refined those designs over the next century, which led to two-masted ketches. Further development over the age of sail would result in bomb vessels designed as full-rigged ships (with three masts) – which allowed them to function as escort sloops between battles.

A bomb ketch is treated as a small vessel in Black Seas with a mortar mounted on the bow. It functions similarly to a gunboat, but benefits from greater speed and durability.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Amfitryon
boardgame.description:
A trivia game about food, wine and etiquette.

The gameplay is similar to Trivial Pursuit, you roll a die to move, and pick up question cards. From the card, you're posed an easy (A) or difficult (B) question in one of three categories (food, wine or etiquette). Answer the question correctly, and you get to roll the die and move again.

When landing on a corner tile, you'll need to answer both the A and the B questions on the card correctly. If you do, you'll earn a special "diploma card". The first person to get three diploma cards wins the game.

boardgame.name: Refighting History: Volume 3 – The War of the Austrian Succession: Hohenfriedberg, Soor and Rocoux
boardgame.description:
Volume Three of Refighting History follows on from Volume Two continuing to examine and refight the battles of the War of the Austrian Succession.
There are two more of Frederick’s big battles.
These are Hohenfriedberg and Soor, each divided into two games.
There is in addition a rather unusual game featuring the attack on Frederick’s camp by Nádasdy and Trenck during the battle of Soor.

However, the War of the Austrian Succession involved other armies and theatres of operations. Having covered Hohenfriedberg and Soor in this volume the focus move to the western theatre to cover the Rocoux. Here the French forces of Marshal Saxe face the Allied Army including Britain.

In addition to these battles, six games in all, there is the usual update on Charles’ wargame armies and some additional thoughts on artillery.

—description from designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: War of the Austrian Succession

boardgame.name: Epic Skater 2
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Prepare yourself for a skateboarding game to compete with the likes of the Tony Hawk franchise. Hop on your board and shred, grind, flip, grab and spin your way to the highest combos.

Play in career mode to unlock levels. Or try your hand at an endless mode where the points keep coming faster and faster.

Customize your skater. Upgrade your tricks. Land killer combos for huge points.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Beastgrave – Faction Dice Packs
boardgame.description: These are sets of dice themed for the different factions in Warhammer Underworlds: BeastGrave. They each contain 8 six-sided dice - 5 Attack dice and 3 Defense dice, with the appropriate symbols on each.

boardgame.name: Ceramus
boardgame.description:
You are the artist with the most important task! Create an incredible panel with tiles that permeate different styles and moments in the history of the world. From Islamic to Dutch, from Victorian to Art Deco and more. In Ceramus you need to manage your pieces well, use creativity and strategy and pay attention to details, after all, if you don't do your best, your opponent will surely do it.

With fun gameplay, Ceramus will guide you through a quick game of building and combining tiles from a matrix. You will be able to buy pieces - tiles, move them over your panel and create combinations to dominate the game and win Ceramas - coins that allow you to cheat ... a little.

A game of patterns, colors and cultures in tiles.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: JailBird
boardgame.description:
JailBird is a bird-themed party card game where the main objective is for you to be the last bird standing, leaving all your avian accomplices in the custody of the Bird Police while you fly free.

You and your bird friends have committed heinous crimes, but not very well. In the deck of cards are evidence cards which prove you have committed these crimes. Use action cards to get rid of evidence cards in your hand.

Get rid of them now, because once someone draws a Bird Police card, all hell breaks loose! When that happens, a police raid takes place. The person with the most evidence at the end of the raid is sent to jail and is out of the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bloody Demon Slayers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

...A game about monster hunters on their periods...

You’re a demon slayer, a magical warrior blessed by the moon with powers when menstruating. You use these powers to fight corruption wherever it roams, to beat back the foul forces of evil who lurk in the dark. The night is blessed by the moon and her children protect it.

In Bloody Demon Slayers you play magical warriors tasked with protecting the world from evil. It draws on popular media such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Sailor Moon to create a unique peroid-based gaming system.

boardgame.name: Camp Pleasant - Join Today for Maximum Murder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Camp Pleasant is a cooperative storytelling game about nights spent with friends, the end of the holidays, new beginnings, secrets and murder.

The players are all camp counselors, getting together for one last campfire hangout before heading to their separate lives again. This is their last chance for shared memories, to air grievances, or poke at secrets. It’s been a long, hard vacation with just a spot of murder. Life can be a bummer sometimes.

boardgame.name: The Everlasting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Everlasting is a GMless roleplay game where you play a member of the Everlasting—an immortal guardian of your familial line. Your job is to navigate a treacherous immortal society and keep your family safe. Politik, backstab, seduce—do anything in your power to make sure your family stays alive. Your vitality is tied to your family and when the last member of your blood dies, you die too.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
The second edition Warhammer 40,000 Rulebook was published in 1993 as a softcover book and was included with the second edition starter set. Its companion books (Warhammer 40,000: Wargear (2nd Edition), Codex Imperialis, Codex Army Lists) were devoted to background, wargear and army lists, while the Rulebook detailed how to play the game. It contains 8 pages of full-colour images in the centre, a weapon summary and quick reference sheet at the end. The combat rules and shooting were identical to those of Necromunda. The much more complex nature of the rules meant that games were intended to be played on a much smaller scale than the current Warhammer 40,000 rules.

Box Contents:

Game rules and background:
Warhammer 40,000 Rulebook
Warhammer 40,000 Wargear (weapons and wargear rules}
Warhammer 40,000 Codex lmperialis (background for game factions plus rules for different units/characters}
Warhammer 40,000 Codex army lists
Warhammer 40,000 Battle for Armageddon scenarios (scenarios that make use of boxed game miniatures}
Warhammer 40,000 How to paint your models
How to play Warhammer 40,000 (a ‘getting started’ run through of the rules)
Warhammer 40,000 Rules summery card
Warhammer 40,000 Weapons summery card

Miniatures:
20 Orks (bolt pistol and axe)
40 Gretchin (autogun)
1 cardboard Ork dreadnought and stand
2 Space Marine Sergeants (bolt pistol and chainsword)
2 Space Marines with flamers
2 Space Marines with rocket launchers
14 Space Marines with bolters

Vehicle Datafaxes:
1 Space Marine Rhino
1 Space Marine Dreadnought
1 Space Marine Predator
1 Space Marine Land Raider

Wargear Cards:

Mission Cards (one of each pair is green and the other is blue):
2 ‘Engage and Destroy’ mission cards
2 ‘The Assassins’ mission cards
2 ‘Dawn Raid’ mission cards
2 ‘Take and Hold’ mission cards

Play aids:
20 cardboard ruins
3 squad references cards (1 Space Marine, 1 Ork, 1 Gretchin)
Victory point record chart
1 vehicle turning template
1 Thudgun template (made of four connected 1” blast templates)
1 blast template — 1"
1 blast template — 1.5"
1 blast template — 2"
1 blast template — 3"
2 vortex templates — 1.5"
1 hand flamer template
1 flamer template
1 heavy flamer template
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 1993 Origins Awards Best Miniatures Rules Winner
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Angels of Death
Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Sisters of Battle

boardgame.name: Guardians of Aimsir
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Guardians of Aimsir is a diceless, colouring-based role play game. You play a steed of the majestic Unicorn Guardians, in service of the great Queen, who are charged with the protection of all of Aimsir. While she slumbers it is your job to protect Aimsir from all threats no matter what the cost.

Guardians of Aimsir is a game about colours, storytelling, and unicorns! It’s a simple game that uses basic mechanics and encourages anyone playing it to doodle, draw, and colour away to their heart’s content. Unicorns don’t take themselves too seriously and you shouldn’t either while playing this game. As a Unicorn you’ll use your majesty, magical powers, and magnificence to defend the realm of Aimsir from danger. Go forth brave steed and defend our realm!

boardgame.name: Haven AE
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The year is 2250, two centuries after humanity scrambled for survival in Earth’s dying days. The wealthy few and workers with the right skills fled to Mars and Venus, throwing themselves onto the mercy of private companies owning those planets. The desperate and poor holed up in giant domed bastions on Earth, of which only dread Acheron still survives. For average folk though, the digital realm offered their best chance of survival. The framework already stood, and most people had internet access. The promise of a virtual life seemed more alluring than Haven was built on a framework of patched-together MMO’s, the internet, and private company relays.

You are a Breaker, rebelling against the capitalist system that governs Haven. The ruling elite seeks to destroy you for your failure to comply. The Code, the engine which built your reality, seeks to destroy you for breaking the rules. For you, it’s liberty or death.

boardgame.name: Keepers of Antarra
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Antarra, continent of unparallelled wonder and terror, floats amid an ocean of crystal. The crystal travels far underneath Antarra’s war-torn surface and carries magic in its veins. Towers sit atop the greatest crossroads of crystal, controlled by warlocks and demigods who seek to shape Antarra in their own image. Only one can prevail, seize control of the crystal lines, and become the new Keeper of Antarra.

boardgame.name: Kitten Witches
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are all witch familiars. Well okay, witch familiars in training. Okay, okay! You’re a litter of kittens born to a witch’s familiar...

Kitten Witches is set in a world much like ours, except fairy tale creatures are real. These creatures aren’t ‘evil’ in the sense of being deliberately malicious, but they do prey on mortals for sustenance (dreams are delicious, nightmares even more so!) and occasionally tribute such as coins, teeth, or worship. They especially like to prey on mortal children, who are often disbelieved by the adults in their lives, and whose emotions are so wonderful.

boardgame.name: Het Tijdschrift: The Journal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This game starts with a journal.

You are the descendant of a heroine of the Dutch resistance in WW2. After the war she was not honoured, she was given no medal, she was afforded no celebration, but her spirit lives on in the people who she saved and het tijdschrift (the journal). Read her memoirs, tell her story, and have her deeds live on through you.

boardgame.name: We Die Here
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We Die Here explores the lives and secrets of a small, isolated town. It was inspired by my love for stories like Twin Peaks, Stephen King’s It, and Netflix’ Dark, where the town is as much a character in the story as its inhabitants. Isolated, turned inward, and more than a little creepy, the town is the monster in this tale. It rarely lets people go: characters are born and die here - and only if they’re very lucky does the latter come as the natural end to a long life.

Each character, including the town itself, has three basic drives: a Need, Want, and Secret they desperately seek to keep. While every player creates their own character, they create the town together with the GM assigning it a Need, Want, and Secret.

boardgame.name: The Wicked Sisters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A tarot-based game about women with powers.

In The Wicked Sisters you play a group of prehistoric women from when the world was new and myths were formed. These Sisters shape the way of things for years to come, their influence living on the wind, and their voices whispered through darkness. The Sisters flee from their birth land and are plunged into a strange new land from which they must escape. At least one Sister must make across the land, to sing her stories to the stars and ensure the Sisters’ legacies live on.

The Wicked Sisters uses a tarot deck to amp up the drama of the game. Players and their GM will make various tarot Readings throughout the game in order to change and influence scenes they play. All information you need to perform the tarot Readings is included in this game.

boardgame.name: You & I at the End of the World
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You & I at the End of the World (You & I) is a letter writing role playing game for two players set in an apocalyptic future. You and another player correspond via letters, emails, or notes guided by writing prompts and each other’s replies. At the end of the game you decide whether or not you trust this other person enough to meet them in person.
boardgame.rpg: You & I at the End of the World

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition Box Set was a starter set for the 3rd Edition of Warhammer 40,000 released in 1998.

The box set contained the rulebook but the rulebook was also available on its own.

Contents:
- Black Templars: 9 Space Marines, 1 Space Marine Sergeant, 1 Landspeeder
- Dark Eldar: 20 Kabalite Warriors
- Other: Scenery, 6 Dice, templates, Rulebook. Reference Sheets

boardgame.name: Clean Cut
boardgame.description:
Clean Cut has 2 decks of 6 cards (the same set of 6 for each player), and those cards are used to construct a small time track. The cards quickly cycle back into the players' hands, with most of the game spent holding 4 cards.

The timing of card effects is based on the orientation of the cards, using markings on them to determine the order in which they take effect. Every card has 2 options for how it can be played, with changes to the effect of the card alongside the change in timing. Matches play out fast, because it can potentially only take 2 hits to land a "clean cut" and achieve victory.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Können Taxis fliegen?
boardgame.description:
Can taxis fly? NO!!!

Every child knows that, but it is not always that easy to correctly assess vehicles: Does a jumbo jet have an engine? How many wheels does a truck have? Do you need a driver's license to drive a motorized lawn mower?

Round after round you take a close look at one of 38 great planes, cars and ships. But it's not just a matter of knowledge, a quick reaction is also important.
But beware! If you attribute a wrong feature to a vehicle valuable points might go to another player.

Whoever has the most points after 5 rounds wins.

Based on the game principle of "Can pigs fly?" by Sonja Häßler.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Medico Service
boardgame.description:
Medico Service is campaign primer for Cepheus Engine (and other 2D6 based science fiction systems). This book is designed to give the referee guidance on playing a new kind of campaign. With this primer you'll be inspired to start a campaign where the players are not out for themselves, but instead cruising the space lanes with the aim of maintaining the health and wellbeing of the Empire.

Included is a new career path that enrols the PCs in the Medico Service. The service is an arm of the galaxy-spanning Empire that focuses on combatting the evils that befall man, including but not limited to raging epidemics, erupting volcanoes, and dictators enslaving populations.
- Back-cover blurb

boardgame.name: Merchants of the Dark Road: Lumi Metal Coins
boardgame.description:
Metal Coins for Merchants of the Dark Road.

Replaces the cardboard coins that come in the Standard & Deluxe edition of Merchants of the Dark Road.

Contains 60 bi-color plated metal coins in colors:

30 x 1 (copper; "candles")
18 x 5 (silver; "stars")
12 x 10 (gold; "lamps")

boardgame.name: Stars of Akarios: Neoprene Game Board
boardgame.description:
Neoprene Game Board for Stars of Akarios.

Double-Sided Neoprene Game Mat with Side-Stitched corners for Stars of Akarios that measures 55,88 cm x 55,88 cm (22" x 22").

boardgame.name: Fly or Not
کلاغ پر
boardgame.description:
Can a bird fly? What about a bird tied with chains?? Or a bird tied with chains, with a jet-pack on its back, trapped in a cage which has balloon on top of it???

Fly or Not is an action/dexterity game in which players need to act quickly to grab the right answer to the question "whether the subject is flying or not?" from the table before anyone else can. On each turn players:

Reveal a card; each round a card reveals which shows an animal that may fly or not!
Roll dice; roll 1-3 dice based on the difficulty level which will affect the result.
Grab the answer; if the result of "card+dice" flies, grab the "fly" marker (blue). If not, grab "not fly" marker (orange).
Score points; Players may gain or lose points based on the marker they grabbed.


The first player to achieve a certain number of points (based on the number of players) wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Go Nuts for Donuts: Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
How can you make Go Nuts for Donuts even more delicious? Add more donuts of course! In this Promo Pack there's a variety of delicious goodies that you can pick and choose to use with the base game to give the game more variety and fun!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Go Nuts for Donuts: Diet Free Deck

boardgame.name: Preceptor Service
boardgame.description:
Preceptor Service is a campaign primer for Cepheus Engine (and other 2D6 based science fiction systems). This book is designed to give the referee guidance on playing a new kind of campaign. With this primer you’ll be inspired to start a campaign where the players are not out for themselves but instead, part of a new service, a project to bring civilisation to the uncivilised and to help them join the community of civilised space.

Players become members of a service with the sole aim of uplifting and protecting burgeoning society. The foes they will have to face include predatory corporates seeking to enslave or strip mine, religions promoting backward practices, native leaders seeking to empower themselves, and hostile environments.

-Back cover blurb

boardgame.name: Mercenary Company
boardgame.description:
Mercenary Company is campaign primer for Cepheus Engine (and other 2D6 based science fiction systems). This book is designed to give the referee guidance on playing a campaign where the players are running their own company of Mercenaries. With this primer you'll be inspired to start a private military campaign where the players are out to earn the big-creds that come with the big guns.

-back cover blurb

boardgame.name: China: Europe
boardgame.description: Map of Europe made to fit the rules for China, rather than Web of Power. Can be downloaded from the designer's website.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Adeptus Astartes – Deathwatch
boardgame.description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Eldar – Harlequins
boardgame.description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Codex Eldar – Craftworlds
boardgame.description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.

boardgame.name: Alpha Steel
boardgame.description:
Out on the planet of Ibun, the Bots have created an advanced station. Here, the Bots must show their strength at the Alpha Steel Arena and decide who is the Last Bot Standing. The winner becomes the leader of the Elite Bot Army. The Age of the Human is over, the Age of the Bot begins! Go Droid!

In Alpha Steel, players control futuristic bots on the planet of Ibun. The goal is to defeat all other bots and remain the last player standing, inside the arena.

Everyone starts outside the arena with 1 rookie bot, 70,000 Azol (Azol- the currency in the game), 10 energy tokens, and 2 power cards. Each player starts with a rookie bot but can purchase a master bot during the game. On your turn, you will roll both dice.

From each dice you can: gain energy or 30,000 azol or attack other players’ bots. If you roll the same on both dice, you get double! For each attack you roll, your bot deals damage to other bots. The amount of damage you cause is written on your bot card. If you’re inside the arena, you attack everyone else. But if you’re outside the arena, you will only attack whoever is inside.

At the start, everyone is outside and the first player to roll an attack, enters the arena. All the other bots suffer damage. If you wish to leave the arena, you must wait till someone attacks you. Then, you pay the damage and exit. The player who had attacked you, must enter the arena.

If you stay in the arena for one whole round, you get 30,000 Azol after your dice roll. When you are inside, you can never gain health.

Power cards give your bots special strengths. you can play only one power card on your turn and must give it up after use. Some power cards can be played anytime. At no point can you have more than 2 power cards with you. Each power card has cost price and a profit or loss percentage mentioned in them. So, when you sell a card you do so either at a profit or a loss. All power cards sell at 50% loss, while all rookie bots sell at 50% profit. You can buy only one power card or a bot at the end of your turn. But, if you are inside the arena, you can buy a power card or bot anytime. If another player attacks you and you cannot pay Azol, you can sell your power card to get azol, otherwise you are eliminated. If you ever run out of energy tokens, you are eliminated!

When only two players remain in the game, it is the final duel. Both their bots enter the arena. You cannot buy any power cards or bots. you also cannot get energy or azol from dice.However, you can use the power cards you already have. The duel continues till a player is eliminated.

A round of play:
Your turn begins by rolling both dice. Then, you can play your power card. Other players cannot play a power card unless it is a play anytime card. Now, resolve the dice roll. remember if you are inside, you attack everyone. if you are outside, you only attack the person inside. Next, you can buy a power card or a bot. the player inside can buy anytime, other players can buy only on their turn. If the player inside wants to exit, they must do it now. If they exit, you must enter the arena. A player cannot exit if you did not roll an attack. Your turn ends.

Alpha Steel is a strategy based board game that is perfect for all ages. Whether it’s game night with friends, weekends with family or to combine the power of learning and play for kids, the board game provides an awesome experience for all. Enjoy as you use your robot’s special powers and tactics to vanquish other bots and lead the entire bot army.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Type 7
boardgame.description:
Solitaire and 2 Player Submarine Warfare.
It´s 1939. You possess authentic weapons and technology in a thrilling fog of war where every decicion you take may be your last.
A system of rotatable discs defines your encounters with the enemy by storing all the data and reactions.

You fight to stay alive and to fulfill your secret missions. A 63 cm long wooden U-boat is used to store wooden torpedoes and fuel during the game. The deck’s gun ammo is represented by wooden shells of different kinds and stored in a 20-round wooden magazine. All game tokens are made of wood and engraved as well. Burnt wood sets you back in time and deep under the surface of the ocean. You can call a wolfpack to support you or dive deep to avoid attacks while risking that the pressure may crack your hull every second.

You play multiple missions in every chapter and have unique targets each time. Move your ship above a overworld map and choose your path there. Fuel is used to keep on moving or follow your targets and alter the weather and daytime conditions. Support tickets allows you to refill your ammo and fuel or order combat support via radio. If you encounter enemies at the overworld map you start a combat loop which will be ended after you defeated your enemies or managed to escape. After each mission you will update your crew or even buy new technology for your submarine.

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
This is the Deluxe Kickstarter version which contains a Display Type 7 U Boat as well as the in game version of the U Boat and the free gift which is a nuclear cloud.. All the game pieces have been assembled and the game U Boat has been glued in such a way that it comes apart in three pieces for storage. The display version has not been assembled. I have listed it as "Very Good" because it has been assembled rather than because there are any faults with the pieces. Everything packs away into the Type 7 crate. The parcel weighs 4Kgms and I would prefer to post to UK only.
My reason for selling is that I design print and play solo narrative games (Corvette Command and Nightfighter Command are my first 2) and as I publish these for free I need to raise money to cover my research materials (books and DVDs). So if you buy this game you will be helping me to create even more games in the future.

boardgame.name: Galaxy Raiders
boardgame.description:
Humans have entered the Space Age! As the Commander General of your space fleet, you are in charge of finding and capturing new planets and moons. But, you must use all your powers to defeat the other Galaxy Raiders. Ready? Time warp...activate!

In Galaxy Raiders, players are in charge of finding and capturing new planets and moons.

Place the hexagonal boards in the center. Each hexagonal board has one planet and 4 moons on it. Yhere are two numbers in each half of the planet and one number in every moon.

All players start with a console mat and eight pegs of one colour. The card deck consists of number cards and power cards. The deck is shuffled and each player gets seven cards. There is a dice with 4 operations & 2 any operation symbols.

On your turn, you roll the dice. Using the operation you roll and any two number cards you have, you must capture a number position on the board. Once your cards are played, they are discarded. Pick up an equal amount of cards from the deck. At all times each player must have seven cards with them. Rules for capturing a number position:

You must capture at least one moon to be able to enter that planet.
If you have captured all the moons, nobody else can enter that planet.
You can enter a planet only after all four moons have been captured - either by you or by others.
You need to capture both halves of the planet to win the planet.
Once you win a planet, give the pegs of that planet back to the respective players and take the planet's hexagonal board and keep it with you.

The power cards allow you to either evict another player from the moon or planet position or replace them in that position. If you cannot perform an operation, but have a power card then you must play it. You cannot simply skip your turn. But, if you don’t have a power card you still discard a card and pick one up from the deck, you then either use your new card or pass your turn.

The rules of entry, are first, moon then planet and rules of eviction, are first, planet then moon.

The first player to capture two planets or with the highest points, wins the game. If all number positions are captured then there is a “stalemate”, then points are counted. the points system is:

each moon equals 1 point
each half of a planet equals 2 points
total value of a planet equals 8 points
Player with the highest points wins!
Galaxy Raiders is a game of planning, strategy and negotiation. Challenge your friends and family to see who will emerge victorious in this engaging battle of wits. Enjoy with them as they set forth on a galactic conquest to capture planets and moons using your mathematical prowess. For parents with young kids, it's the perfect way to introduce them to an entire learning multiverse. See them transform into problem-solving geniuses right before your eyes! A true interstellar skirmish, perfect for all ages!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: A Long, Hard Road: The Battle of Dubno, June 23-27, 1941
boardgame.description:
“If I’d known the Russians had so many tanks I would not have attacked!” --Adolf Hitler

A Long, Hard Road: The Battle of Dubno is a moderate complexity level wargame simulation of the first major clash of large armored formations on the East Front. After launching Operation Barbarossa, the invasion of the Soviet Union on June 22nd, the First Panzer Group of the German Sixth Army led the offensive into the Ukraine. Critical to the German success in the opening days was taking the main road leading to Kiev and Kharkov, and the bridges spanning the Ikva and Styr rivers. Any delays or setbacks here could have severe repercussions as the other German Army Groups and panzer formations drove deeper along Sixth Army’s flanks. Desperate to stop the German blitzkrieg, Joseph Stalin, over the objections of General Zhukov, ordered an immediate counter-attack. The largest tank battle of the war to that date was the result. Can you do as well or better?

A complete game of A Long, Hard Road is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 inch map sections
• 279 double-sided, un-mounted counters.
• One players’ aide sheet
• 8 pages of rules

Players will also need one six (D6) and one ten-sided (D10) dice to play the game. Each day turn of the game represents 8 hours of time. Units are mostly brigades and regiments. Each hex is approximately 1.25 miles across.

—description from designer

listing.notes: Game with mounted counters

For sale is a brand new copy of A Long, Hard Road by the designer and publisher.
Mounted counters can be had for an additional $8.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.description:
Lost and wandering Europe for years with her brother Pietro, Wanda Maximoff had little idea of the arcane powers vested in her—until she unleashed her reality-warping chaos magic to protect the innocent. Now in the guise of Scarlet Witch, Wanda has joined the Avengers, fighting alongside her brother!

Like previous Hero Packs, the Scarlet Witch Hero Pack for Marvel Champions: The Card Game unlocks a brand-new hero for your games, coming with a fully pre-built and ready-to-play 40-card Justice deck. Alongside this pre-built deck, you’ll find an assortment of cards for the other aspects of the game, giving you plenty of options for tweaking your Scarlet Witch deck or altering any other deck in your collection. Prepare for reality to twist and warp around you with this new Hero Pack!

After she escaped with the help of a Pym Particle sample, Nadia immigrated to the United States, where she built her own Wasp suit and joined the Avengers, using her powers to fight villains of any size!

This Hero Pack includes a 40-card pre-built deck featuring the Aggression aspect that’s ready to play right out of the pack, and whether you’re most excited to jump into action as Wasp or add new cards to your other heroes, you’ll find plenty to enjoy within this expansion.

boardgame.name: Guess the Fence
boardgame.description:
Protect your farm from all kinds of harm! You’ve decided to add fences to your large farm. Anything to keep the nosy neighbours away, right? But shhh, you have to build them secretly! Whoever guesses the fences made by the other farmer, wins. Think smart, guess patiently and fence away!

In Guess the Fence, you must protect your farm from all kinds of harm. The goal is to guess all the fences made by your opponent. Each player starts with: a farm board, an erasable marking sheet, 3 long fences, 3 diagonal fences and 8 small fences, one red and green marker. The partition board is placed between the players. Each farm board has a grid of 25 numbers.On their board, each player makes 4 shapes using their fences - a square, a rectangle, a big triangle and a small triangle. The fences are placed along the dotted lines only. The circle of the fence is the vertex of the shape and must be placed on a number. The end of a fence must meet another vertex. The shapes must not have shared vertices or sides. Once both players have made their fences, the game begins.On your turn, you can either guess a vertex or guess a shape. When you guess a vertex-
Look at your marking sheet and call out a number where you think your opponent may have a vertex
Your opponent looks at their farm board and tells you if it is right or wrong.
If correct, they say ‘hit’ and you shade that vertex number in green.
if wrong, they say ‘miss’ and you shade that vertex number in red.
When you guess a shape (calling out the vertex of that shape)-
Look at your marking sheet and call out a shape where you think your opponent has made one
You must say the name of the shape and all its vertices. for e.g. “do you have a triangle at 3,4 and 9?”
Your opponent, then, looks at their farm board and tells you if it is right or wrong.
If correct, they say ‘hit’ and you get 3 points, and shade the shape!
If wrong, they say ‘miss’ and you lose 1 point!
When a player guesses all the shapes of the other, the game ends. The person with the highest points, wins!

Guess The Fence is a guess-and-write game that will help burgeon your visual reasoning and creativity. It’s perfect for families to have a great time but also introduce kids to an innovative learning experience. Enjoy with them as they apply their knowledge of geometry to make shapes with fences and develop essential skills that go beyond academics. See their creativity and imagination soar right before your eyes! This is a simple but highly addictive educational game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Camp Pinetop: Observation Tower
boardgame.description:
The Observation Tower expansion will add another great twist to Camp Pinetop. During set-up the Observation Tower will be placed out on a random map tile. During gameplay when you are on a random row or column with the Observation Tower you will gain additional benefits.

Adding the Double Supply Cards will give an added strategy to the game. During play you will rank up and this will decrease the amount of cards you can have in your hand. The Double Supply Cards can count as two supply cards of that kind instead of the standard one.
